rev.comment: Unneeded fair use; cover exists on article about the book, which is linked here twice, and the rationale of "T o illustrate the article" is exceptionally weak
rev.diff:
Line 46: Line 46:
In October 2008, Auel was named an Officer of the [[Ordre des Arts et des Lettres]] by the French Minister of Culture and Communication.<ref>{{cite web| title=Jean Auel wins French award | date=October 13, 2008 | url= http://blog.oregonlive.com/books/2008/10/jean_auel_wins_french_award.html | publisher=[[The Oregonian]] | work= Bookmarks (a literary blog)| author=Jeff Baker| accessdate=2010-05-04}}</ref>
In October 2008, Auel was named an Officer of the [[Ordre des Arts et des Lettres]] by the French Minister of Culture and Communication.<ref>{{cite web| title=Jean Auel wins French award | date=October 13, 2008 | url= http://blog.oregonlive.com/books/2008/10/jean_auel_wins_french_award.html | publisher=[[The Oregonian]] | work= Bookmarks (a literary blog)| author=Jeff Baker| accessdate=2010-05-04}}</ref>
â
[[File:Auel, Jean M - The Clan Of The Cave Bear.jpg|right|thumb|150px]]
 
==Bibliography==
==Bibliography==
By 1990, Auel's first three books in her [[Earth's Children]] series sold more than 20 million copies worldwide and had been translated into 18 languages; [[Crown Publishing Group|Crown Publishers]] has reportedly paid Auel about $25 million for the rights to publish ''The Plains of Passage'' and the two subsequent volumes.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.time.com/time/printout/0,8816,971440,00.html | title= Books: Queen of The Ice Age Romance | publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] | date= October 22, 1990 | accessdate=2010-05-04}}</ref> By May 2002, on the cusp of the publication of the fifth book, the series had sold 34 million books.<ref name="time2002">{{cite web | url=http://www.time.com/time/printout/0,8816,971440,00.html | title= Books: Romancing The Stone Age | publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] | date= May 13, 2002 | accessdate=2010-05-04}}</ref>. On May 27, 2010, it was announced that the sixth and final book in the series, The Land of Painted Caves, will be published March 29, 2011<ref name="publisher's weekly"> {{cite web | url=http://www.publishersweekly.com/pw/by-topic/book-news/deals/article/43338-new-jean-m-auel.html | title="New Jean Auel" | date= May 27, 2010 | accessdate=2010-05-27}} </ref>.
By 1990, Auel's first three books in her [[Earth's Children]] series sold more than 20 million copies worldwide and had been translated into 18 languages; [[Crown Publishing Group|Crown Publishers]] has reportedly paid Auel about $25 million for the rights to publish ''The Plains of Passage'' and the two subsequent volumes.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.time.com/time/printout/0,8816,971440,00.html | title= Books: Queen of The Ice Age Romance | publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] | date= October 22, 1990 | accessdate=2010-05-04}}</ref> By May 2002, on the cusp of the publication of the fifth book, the series had sold 34 million books.<ref name="time2002">{{cite web | url=http://www.time.com/time/printout/0,8816,971440,00.html | title= Books: Romancing The Stone Age | publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] | date= May 13, 2002 | accessdate=2010-05-04}}</ref>. On May 27, 2010, it was announced that the sixth and final book in the series, The Land of Painted Caves, will be published March 29, 2011<ref name="publisher's weekly"> {{cite web | url=http://www.publishersweekly.com/pw/by-topic/book-news/deals/article/43338-new-jean-m-auel.html | title="New Jean Auel" | date= May 27, 2010 | accessdate=2010-05-27}} </ref>.
